Articles.Content:
Hello everyone !

Is there some shortcuts to activate science such as "crew report", "temperature measure", ...to go quickly than clicking on every parts to earn science ?

Thank you !
You can set up an action group and just assign all of your science parts to the same group so that when you press the button is does all the experiments at the same time.

Yep. Action groups.

They're an advanced rocket designer's best friend.

Ok !

Thank you so much !

I haven't see what we can do with action group, never used it, but now is the time !

Unfortunately action groups suck if you have several science parts set up with symmetry. Realize if you use the action group, all the symmetric copies will also take readings. You can reject the duplicates if you want. Then if you use the action group again, only the experiments that are "ready" will run. It will not automatically overwrite your previously saved readings unless you have an action group set up to "reset" them all.

If you're not using symmetry (i.e. only have one of each type of experiment on board), then action groups work great.
Is there a hotkey to bring up the experiments collected menu? I sometimes lose track of experiments if I click "store" with the intent of transmitting later.

Is there a hotkey to bring up the experiments collected menu? I sometimes lose track of experiments if I click "store" with the intent of transmitting later.

Pretty sure that can be set to an action group too. I'm almost certain that if it is a right click option that it can be action-grouped.

Is there a hotkey to bring up the experiments collected menu? I sometimes lose track of experiments if I click "store" with the intent of transmitting later.

Unfortunately you can't hotkey the data windows (not that I have found anyway). For just about every piece of science equipment, about all you can hotkey is turning it on, taking the data, resetting it. And oddly enough you don't really need to turn them on (toggle displays, etc) in order to "take data."

But in case you didn't know, you can right click on the modules and review the data. If the data is gone (collected or transmitted) then there won't be any data to review.
